content: Singaporean soup**This article has multiple issues.** Please help **improve it** or discuss these issues on the **talk page**. *(Learn how and when to remove these messages)*The topic of this article **may not meet Wikipedia's general notability guideline**. If notability cannot be shown, the article is likely to be merged, redirected, or deleted. *Find sources:* "Sliced fish soup" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(October 2015)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*This article **relies largely or entirely on a single source**. Relevant discussion may be found on the talk page. Please help improve this article by introducing citations to additional sources. *Find sources:* "Sliced fish soup" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(May 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Sliced fish soup** is a popular dish in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), believed to have originated from the [Teochews](/wiki/Teochew_people). It consists of [fish](/wiki/Fish_as_food), [vegetables](/wiki/Vegetable), and beancurd; with the addition of cuttlefish and [prawns](/wiki/Shrimp_and_prawn_as_food), the dish is called seafood soup. It is sold in most hawker centres and usually costs between SGD 3.50 and SGD 5. - [List of soups](/wiki/List_of_soups) - Food portal This [soup](/wiki/Soup)-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Sliced fish soup
